Highly purified mycobacterial phosphatidylinositol mannosides drive cell-mediated responses and activate NKT cells…

citation.abstract: Mycobacterial lipids play an important role in the modulation of the immune response upon contact with the host. Using novel methods, we have isolated highly purified PIM molecules (PIM2, AcPIM2, Ac2PIM2, AcPIM6 and Ac2PIM6) from virulent Mycobacterium tuberculosis to assess their potential to stimulate PBMC responses in M. bovis infected cattle. Of these molecules, 1 (AcPIM6) induced significant levels of IFN-γ in bovine PBMC. Three PIM molecules (AcPIM6, Ac2PIM2 and Ac2PIM6) were shown to drive significant proliferation in bovine PBMC. AcPIM6 was subsequently used to phenotype the proliferating cells by flow cytometry. This analysis demonstrated that AcPIM6 was predominantly recognised by CD3(+) CD335(+) NKT cells. In conclusion, we have identified PIM lipid molecules that interact with bovine lymphocyte populations and these lipids may be useful as future subunit vaccines or diagnostic reagents. Further, these data demonstrate, for the first time, lipid specific NKT activation in cattle.
citation.title: Highly purified mycobacterial phosphatidylinositol mannosides drive cell mediated responses and activate NKT cells in cattle.
